Detailed Description

This class implements a data descriptor for Mysql databases.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

plMysqlDataDescriptor::plMysqlDataDescriptor ( const plVariablesConjunction &  variables,
const std::string &  host,
const std::string &  user,
const std::string &  passwd,
const std::string &  db,
const std::string &  query,
bool  cache_data = true,
unsigned int  port = 0,
const std::string &  unix_socket = "",
unsigned long  client_flag = 0 
)
inline

Constructor using database parameters and associating it to a set of variables.

Parameters
[in]variablesThe set of variables to be associated to the descriptor.
[in]hostHost name (address).
[in]userMysql user name.
[in]passwdUser's password.
[in]dbDatabase name.
[in]queryThe query to execute.
[in]cache_datatrue if we want to store the data in client's memory.
[in]portPort number (use the default parameter's value when possible).
[in]unix_socketThe path to the used unix socket (use the default parameter's value when possible).
[in]client_flagConnection client flag (use the default parameter's value when possible).

References PL_NO_ERROR, and set_variables().

plMysqlDataDescriptor::plMysqlDataDescriptor ( const std::string &  host,
const std::string &  user,
const std::string &  passwd,
const std::string &  db,
const std::string &  query,
bool  cache_data = true,
unsigned int  port = 0,
const std::string &  unix_socket = "",
unsigned long  client_flag = 0 
)
inline

Constructor using database parameters without associating it to a set of variables.

The actual association to a set of variables could be done later by calling set_variables().

Parameters
[in]hostHost name (address).
[in]userMysql user name.
[in]passwdUser's password.
[in]dbDatabase name.
[in]queryThe query to execute.
[in]cache_datatrue if we want to store the data in client's memory.
[in]portPort number (use the default parameter's value when possible).
[in]unix_socketThe path to the used unix socket (use the default parameter's value when possible).
[in]client_flagConnection client flag (use the default parameter's value when possible).

References PL_NO_ERROR.

const std::string &  query,
bool  cache_data = true

Parameters

[in]queryThe query to execute.
[in]cache_datatrue if we want to store the data in client's memory.

Member Function Documentation

bool plMysqlDataDescriptor::get_data_record ( const plValues *&  data_values,
const std::vector< bool > *&  data_definition 
)
inlinevirtual

Get the next data record (row) and advances by one record in the data.

Parameters
[out]data_valuesan array of values for all variables described in the record.
[out]data_definitiona vector stating, for each value in data_values, whether it's defined or not.
Returns
false iif the end of the container is reached.

The returned pointers are managed internally: you should not attempt to delete them, or use them after another call to get_data_record(). Also, you should not use them when get_data_record() returns false.

Implements plDataDescriptor.

References plValues::size().

virtual unsigned int plMysqlDataDescriptor::get_n_records ( )
inlinevirtual

Get the number of records (rows) in the data set.

ATTENTION: if not cached, the first call scans the data set and thus has a complexity of O(n) where n is the size.

Returns
the size of the data set.

Reimplemented from plDataDescriptor.

References plDataDescriptor::get_n_records().

inlinevirtual

Returns the number of fields (columns).

Returns
the number of fields (columns/variables).

Implements plDataDescriptor.

Referenced by set_variables().

inlineprotectedvirtual

Writes the object at the out stream.

Reimplemented from plDataDescriptor.

void plMysqlDataDescriptor::set_variables ( const plVariablesConjunction &  variables)
inline

Set the variables to be associated to the data descriptor.

This method is to be called when the descriptor is constructed without providing the variables list. After this call, observed_variables() will return the passed 'variables' parameter.

Parameters
[in]variablesThe variables to be associated to the data descriptor

References plVariablesConjunction::dim(), get_num_fields(), plVariablesConjunction::get_type(), plVariablesConjunction::get_var_type(), plVariablesConjunction::is_empty(), and PL_LABEL.

Referenced by plMysqlDataDescriptor().
